principles.title: Contract Formation
principles.description: The essential elements required for a valid contract under Indian Contract Law
key_principles: Offer and acceptance must be clear and unambiguous
There must be lawful consideration (something of value exchanged)
Parties must have the capacity to contract
Free consent is essential (no coercion, undue influence, fraud, misrepresentation)
The object and consideration must be lawful

principles.title: Breach of Contract
principles.description: Principles governing breach of contract and available remedies
key_principles: Actual breach occurs when a party fails to perform their obligations
Anticipatory breach occurs when a party indicates they will not perform
Damages aim to put the injured party in the position they would have been in had the contract been performed
Specific performance may be ordered when damages are inadequate
The injured party has a duty to mitigate their losses

principles.title: Negligence
principles.description: Fundamental principles of negligence in civil law
key_principles: A duty of care must exist between the parties
The duty must have been breached by falling below the standard of care
The breach must have caused actual damage or loss
The damage must have been reasonably foreseeable
The plaintiff must prove all elements on a balance of probabilities
